Technique: ENGOBE; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Pitcher
Description: Pitcher with narrow mouth, flat rim with moulding and narrow neck with well-marked tapering walls. The body has straight walls with a double sharp curvature and a stable base with ring-shaped foot. It has a ribbon handle which starts at the middle part of the body and ends at the upper curvature. Orangey-coloured paste and surface of a reddish colour with a coating of the same colour, partially lost. The pitcher bears a painted decoration based on dark red bands demarcated by black lines which encircle the piece.
